storyInfo: The Law reveals its true nature—a PCS system created by a previous civilization—and thrusts Federico and Andoain into a simulation. The Doctor learns Priestess's true motive for coming to Laterano: to use PCS to unify all the races into one, allowing for the smoother propagation of Originium.

attributes.content: There is no complicated ceremony, no tedious process to undergo.
Federico looks at the frigid information port. All it takes is a flicker of his halo to reveal an infinity of sights.
Halos can transfer this much information this quickly?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Neither medical texts nor ancient scripture have ever described this phenomenon. From antiquity, halos have only ever transferred simple emotions through the process we call empathy.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Why is that?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.text: Interaction target information handling capacity insufficient. Pre-interaction information conversion required.
\n\nPerforming information conversion during interaction may cause damage to information processor of interaction target, leading to temporary and/or permanent disability.
\n\nAndoain Agathangelos is currently in this condition.

attributes.content: Federico looks to his side.
Andoain is slumped to the floor in dismay, his eyes clouded. Dried rivulets of blood frame his features in a worrying manner.
For a moment, he struggles to lift his head, once more pointing his halo at the port.
And once more he feebly hangs his head.
Andoain, according to this machine—or rather, the Law—you cannot handle any further information.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And your prior overuse of Originium Arts has already had an adverse effect on your body.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You are to stop attempting to access the machine immediately, before you cause permanent damage to yourself.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: More information...?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: No, I still haven't seen anything. I still don't know anything!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But this should not be... Why?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: These past ten years, all this suffering, all these sins... Was it all just to meet with a silent god?!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I can't stop here, Federico.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Once more, Andoain Agathangelos stubbornly raises his halo towards the machine.
...The child.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Is this yet another dream?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: It's not. The Law would not construct a dreamscape for you alone.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Federico chose to communicate with the Law in its own language, while you cannot understand it, nor are you willing to accept such an impersonal tongue.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: It is you who, word by word, line by line, 'translated' this language into what we see now.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: If this is not a dream, then why... are you still alive?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Because you wanted me to live, Nurturer.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: I set off that bomb myself... You were there.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Not only did you want me to live, you had great expectations of me.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You hoped I would live a happy life. You hoped I would break through the dome of the Shrine of Nurtury, that I would fly up and touch the sky.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You hoped to see my feathers shine in the sunlight, to see my talons clasp frolicking musbeasts.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You looked up the tallest tree in Terra on the intercity net, didn't you? You thought that, since I'm an arborbeast, I would much rather climb a real tree than comfort bells.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: I did. Atop the mountains of Sami and amidst the forests of Bolívar, there are great trees straight out of legend, stouter than the Tower of Revelations, taller than the Basilica...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I really did think about bringing you to see them. On the net, I saw other arborbeasts up in the canopy crying out to the sun.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I wanted to see you cry out in carefree joy, just like them.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Hmm, where did things go wrong from there?
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: When did you stop treating me as a real life?
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You know, don't you?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: The funeral. My mother's funeral.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: No matter. Come with me. This time, we shall leave behind no regrets.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: What do you mean? Is the funeral still going on?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: The funeral shall never end.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: He is unresponsive.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is he suffering from the same condition as the Pope?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.text: Negative. Andoain Agathangelos is still suitable, and is currently pre-processing information.
\n\nNow, assist in bringing the Transfiguration to completion.

attributes.content: Federico has expressed doubt, has even been shaken by past events, but he has never once questioned the Law.
After all, saints implement the Law, while executors enforce it, as is right and good.
But now, facing the Law itself, he feels only confusion.
I still have doubts.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The ultimate purpose of the Law is to grant halos to all organic and inorganic matter, this I know.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But choosing the Summit of Nations as the method of achieving this... Is this the decree of the Law?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: It's far too inefficient, and its feasibility is questionable.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Summit was meant to found a Terra-wide religion, something unprecedented in the civilized history of this land. Mere proposals, negotiations and revelations of 'miracles' will be insufficient to achieve this.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Not to mention that according to the information I just received, the moment the very first Sankta received their halos, they abandoned their Teekaz mission without the slightest hesitation.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: If my understanding of the halo is correct, bestowing one on an individual is completely unrelated to their faith?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Summit of Nations, the Nativity... These may both be based on an unnecessary precondition.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I must confirm, what is the true nature of the halo?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: And what is the Law, or rather, your self-designation of 'PCS'?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.text: PCS: Personality and Cognition Synchronization system.

attributes.content: That confirms it. My understanding is correct.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Since the Law is able to synchronize personalities and knowledge—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Why not simply synchronize everything directly?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.text: First Circumstellar Habitable Zone Autonomous Technology Operation Convention—
\n\n'The synchronization or revision of personality or cognition must be initiated by the target accepting said synchronization or revision.'

attributes.content: 'Convention'. A form of regulation.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is the Law restricted by any other regulations?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Who established this convention? What mechanism ensures it is followed?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.text: The ability to enforce this convention no longer exists.

attributes.content: A regulation that nobody can enforce is pointless.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: A Law unrestricted by this regulation should be able to ignore principles and break taboos.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Which means I still require an answer. Why were halos used only for empathy before all this?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The answer I obtained earlier was that a majority of humans, rationally, are unable to withstand the direct transmission of information via halo.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But using emotion as the vector of information transfer is even more vague and inefficient, while also being greater burden on the receiver.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Is there a possibility that the issue isn't people lacking the ability to receive information, but rather...?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico pauses for a moment.
But rather that emotion blocks their ability to process this information?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: If the Law that regulates everyone is a system, a machine... Why does He choose to retain humanity's emotions?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Why... retain our humanity?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: We've been walking a very long time now.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: We've only just started. Normally, a man would hope for his journey to be a little longer.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: But nothing's changing as we walk.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Patience, you'll be seeing something familiar very soon.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: As if in response to the arborbeast's words, a shabby cart bearing a thin coffin shudders as it passes by the side of the road, the wind playing a mournful dirge as it blows across the coffin's lid.
That coffin... I've seen it before.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: A Sarkaz they called hero was buried in it.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I've told many people this story. I still remember... that he gave up his life to save everyone in town.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Even though before he did so, he was a dirty, filthy drunkard, spurned by all.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: You didn't stay in that village for very long. You never knew that whenever he drank, he would go about the houses in turn, vomiting over their doors, all while never paying his debts.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Even if he had borrowed the life savings of others. People would scream things like 'moron' and 'lowlife' at him, but in his eyes, he was getting off lightly.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: When you told this story to the children, did you ever wonder why he so abruptly decided to do such a noble deed that night, a deed the likes of which he had never done before in his entire life?
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: I never figured out why.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Perhaps he had undergone an endless bout of inner struggle and self-questioning, or maybe it was just the urge for a bit of goodwill he couldn't shake.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: All I know is that he didn't do it to be a hero.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: He died, after all. It doesn't matter if we sing his praises, look at him with scorn, or even forget about him. None of that changes anything about him anymore.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Those only have meaning for the living.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: True. Good or bad, reputation is beyond the care of the dead.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: But isn't the process of going to your death also a part of life?
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Those who do not fear death can do the most hideous things.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: During their most carefree of days, rare is the man who will stop to examine himself, for his eyes are fixated on a future filled with limitless possibility.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: But there will come a day that the fog of death ambushes him, a fog that cannot be thrown off no matter how he struggles.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: And there will come a day that he will, in exhaustion, accept the fact that the remainder of his time will be his journey to the afterlife.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: From that moment onwards, to live is to approach death.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: That rainy night, that dirty, filthy Sarkaz drunkard... When he saw that coffin atop the cart, and the figure at the town gates...
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: He knew that was his one and only chance to approach death with some dignity. To him, it was not vanity, but relief.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Perhaps so, but...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: There are always people who do not look towards their deaths.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Are there? Not you, at the very least.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Otherwise, you would not value a funeral so.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You once told me in all earnestness that my mother gave the last of her strength to me. You cared if she died with love in her heart.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You went out of your way to arrange a funeral for her at the Ecclesia Requietum. You cared if she received a proper burial.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You even cared if we were feeling sad enough at her funeral.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: How could you not care about how you will face your own death?
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: I have my path to walk. I've never thought about when death will come for me, or how I should greet it as I follow my path.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Because you still believe your path has meaning.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: A muddled bray overcomes the arborbeast's shrill voice. A sinister monster, bearing sharp horns and claws, creeps along a faraway ridge atop a mountain.
Behind it, several dozen monsters of similar physique jostle against each other, growling as they do so, restlessly following behind their leader.
This... This is that revelation!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Through the spiritual light, even the darkest stain can be cleansed. With a pious heart, even a savage monster can wade out of the mud.
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: They have no halos above their heads, yet they still walk towards a future where all can be saved!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I must go! I must see what road they follow!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: But you're about to go to the funeral with me, aren't you?
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You want to make up for past regrets, right past wrongs, to look upon me as truly alive once again, to give me the happy life I deserve.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Is that not so?
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: But you said the funeral will never end. If it's just a momentary distraction...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: I must go...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: No need to explain yourself.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: This is how you've always been. Always losing yourself in the search, always eager to sacrifice.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: So go, go see what you're searching for truly is.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: At the end of the trail of thorns, the pathfinder stumbles his way towards revelation.
But time overtakes them.
Before his eyes, the pack of fearsome monsters sprout halos and wings of light, like newborn beastlings, dazzling in their brilliance.
The pack leader no longer creeps along the ground. She stands, her jet-black skin peeling away, fluttering through the air like snowflakes.
With every step she takes, her form becomes clearer, until Andoain recognizes her from behind. It is a sight he can never forget.
...Keph?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: That's Keph?! Why...?
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Keph, a Lateran name meaning 'hollow stone' or 'stone-bound law'.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: The First Saint of Laterano, who named herself after her encounter with the Law.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: However, this ancient name she gave herself has been buried deep within the annals of history, alongside her true face.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: So the future I worked so hard to find, that future where all are saved...
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Was just a past deliberately buried... It was just the road we came in on?!
attributes.name: Andoain

attributes.content: Always losing yourself in the search, always eager to sacrifice...
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: It did not stop at sacrificing yourself. You sacrificed Lemuen. You sacrificed Mostima and Fiammetta. You sacrificed your brothers and sisters of the Pathfinders. You sacrificed me.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: And all this time, you never even knew where this path paved with sacrifice led...
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: All you had was blind faith.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Tell me, Nurturer. Do you want to save everyone, or do you think only of consoling yourself?
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: A similar tale to that Sarkaz drunkard, isn't it? Your so-called 'path' is merely your one and only chance to approach death with some dignity.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: You think only of saving yourself.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: No matter. I can offer you even greater salvation.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: Look. We've arrived at the burial ground.
attributes.name: Arborbeast

attributes.content: However, this is not only my mother's funeral, and it's not only yours, either.
Rather, it is the funeral of all things.
This place is kinda scary, Doctor.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: You look at the figure ahead of you, not too close, yet not too far away. She calmly records all the data worth recording wherever she goes.
Occasionally, she will stop somewhere, furrowing her brow without saying a word.

attributes.options: Can you confirm the situation, Mon3tr?;Can you figure a way out, Mon3tr?

attributes.content: I tried to reconnect to the machine, but all the ports have been blocked.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: We can infer that she still possesses some degree of control over our current predicament.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Sorry, Doctor, I'm just as confused as you are.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: I followed your guidance, and checked a few potential places to slip away from... They're all no-gos.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: This is different from the dream that machine made...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Basically, we're trapped.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: ...;Strange thing is, she doesn't seem like she'll do anything to us.;It's like she cares more about gathering that data I can't understand.

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Is there the possibility, Doctor... that she can't do anything to us—
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Do you see these ever-changing buildings around us?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The city known as Laterano is currently experiencing dramatic upheaval, and traces of the damage it has taken will occasionally be mapped onto here.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Changes in information in reality should not be overwriting data inside Originium. This plan still has flaws.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: The Sankta in the city...;So you never actually cared about the Sankta.

attributes.content: I see there's still a great deal of misunderstanding between us, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I believe I can now answer your prior questions. The ones pertaining to the precious results we managed to obtain, alongside the shared vision pieced together by we countless many.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Right now, under my instructions, PCS is reaching its theoretical operational capacity.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: This means it is able to include even more targets in the same language system, far beyond an army or a research team... but rather, a multitude of races.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Through this, connections can be strengthened. Barriers can be broken. Differences can be eliminated.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: That's not such a bad thing. Not the Sankta, not for all life on Terra.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.options: You're sounding like some kind of advocate for interracial harmony.

attributes.content: I can't deny that... though we would benefit as well, of course.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I didn't calibrate PCS to churn out soldiers or scientists we can order about.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Such a plan would collapse at the slightest hint of true disaster. Originium is our only solution.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Needlessly complex biological information will only serve to slow its progress, but PCS has the ability to unify the races into an integrated whole.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It can merge the countless lives of Terra into a singular race, who will pave the way for the expansion of Originium.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: As for whether this unified race can still be considered 'Sankta', I don't particularly care.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It seems PCS is rather set on this outcome, going so far as to autonomously perform many unnecessary inferences for it to come to pass.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It should not have this degree of independence. Perhaps a side effect of the sudden increase in throughput, or an abnormality caused by its long period of disuse...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: If we have the chance, we can spend some time looking into it as a fun diversion... but not right now.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I-I... really don't think she's hiding anything, Doctor.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Hiding?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Rather than allowing you to fool around and break my samples, {@nickname}, I think it would be better if I showed you around personally, just like old times.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The woman reaches her hand out towards you.
She retracts her hand, then turns to continue onwards.
None of this will stop, {@nickname}
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Aren't you interested to see the ultimate outcome?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: She knew you would follow her.
Something's wrong, Doctor. I recorded the route we followed to come here...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: From the Shrine of Nurtury to the Tower of Revelations, then on to the Notarial Hall in Pagus Michaelion, which means the Sunset Chapel is up ahead—
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: Federico mentioned this route to me once during a chat.;It's the route the monsters are following to gather up!

attributes.content: And then there's those unusual scenes of destruction around us. They keep being mapped onto here, which means the chaos in Laterano is still ongoing.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: We've been walking alongside them in a whole different dimension.

attributes.content: The moment you become cognizant of this, you see the stillness of the city begin to break. Motion blossoms across the scene in stutter-freeze frames.
Battle. Explosions. Prayer. Chanting.
You see Exusiai.
You see that hallowed monstrosity—
You cannot tell if this scene has arisen because of your presence, or if she has deigned to allow you to see it.
You should be able to clear your thoughts this way, in a safer manner.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The place you seek is ahead. The location of PCS...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: As well of the destination of the 'Sankta' pilgrims—
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The countdown has begun, {@nickname}.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Seriously, not even time for a breather?
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Keep it quick, Fiammetta.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: I'll cover you while you're reloading.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: What's with the look? We've fought together before. It's not easy to forget how you do things.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: Gratias.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Hey, Mostima, mind explaining to me what the hell just happened?
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: I was kicking a monster's ass when I stepped in one of those weird light puddles on accident, and...
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: Stolide! My boot sprouted a halo outta nowhere!
attributes.name: Fallen Angel

attributes.content: It's one of the Shrine of Nurtury's projections. If you don't feel like being turned into stuff your brain can't even process, then stay away from it!
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: And how're we supposed to do that...?
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: It's spreading way too quick. It'll kick us out of Pagus Saint Marcel before that pack of monsters even gets here...
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: None of us can stick around to play defense at that point!
attributes.name: Sankta Errari

attributes.content: We've stuffed the big pipe organ in the Sunset Chapel full of explosives. Our friends from Leithanien added some self-igniting enchantment on top of it.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Even if nobody's around, it should still be able to blow these freaks to kingdom come.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: The one they used to play the dirge for the city-wide memorial service?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: That's the one.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Sweet. It's had to listen to hundreds of years worth of prayers and sobbing. It's time we play it something with a bit more pep.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Let's get out of here, Patia. Our spent shells have started getting halos.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: The Tower of Revelations in Pagus Ecclesia and the Notarial Hall in Pagus Michaelion have been lost. The Sunset Chapel in Pagus Saint Marcel is the last stop before they reach the Basilica.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: If our bombs don't stop them, then we really are screwed.
attributes.name: Patia

attributes.content: Hah, if Federico and Andoain were right, and the procession really is headed for the Basilica... I think it's too early to throw in the towel.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: I've been a Legatus for a long time now, so I've got experience with getting places quickly.
attributes.name: Mostima
Mostima
attributes.content: If we can't stop them from rushing right over, then...

attributes.name: Mostima
attributes.content: Why not just remove their destination?
Look, Mostima, there's a big difference between blowing up a pipe organ and incinerating the entire Basilica!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: Hey, if boots and Sankta can both have halos, I don't think there's that big a difference between the organ and the Basilica.
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Fine, you're right. Since we can't block or kill that giant monster, we can at least think of a way to make the road not exist anymore. She'll never be able to reach her destination.
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: You sure we're talking about the same thing here?
attributes.name: Mostima

attributes.content: Let's go! Withdraw to the plaza in front of the Basilica!
attributes.name: Fiammetta

attributes.content: *sniffle*... *sob*...
attributes.name: Fearful Child

attributes.content: Wh-What's wrong, Romya?
attributes.name: Panicking Child

attributes.content: Stop crying! You're giving me a headache!
attributes.name: Bolívarian Child

attributes.content: Don't be like that, Hugo.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Why do we need to take care of these crybabies, Sister?
attributes.name: Bolívarian Child

attributes.content: Can we leave Laterano? This place isn't anything like what Aurela said...
attributes.name: Bolívarian Child

attributes.content: Not as nice, right?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Yeah!
attributes.name: Bolívarian Child

attributes.content: I think so too.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: So we should be glad we came to see for ourselves. Otherwise, how would we have known Aurela lied to us?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: We were rather lucky this time, weren't we? Once Aurela comes back, we should give her a good talking-to!
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: R-Right, Sister.
attributes.name: Bolívarian Child

attributes.content: Let's continue with the story, children.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: (Shakes head) I-I'm scared...
attributes.name: Fearful Child

attributes.content: No need to be afraid. Listen. We can still hear the bells, right? The bells of the holy city will protect us.
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: *sobs* ...But those sounds are so loud and scary.
attributes.name: Fearful Child

attributes.content: Hugo, Giselle, do you hear them as well?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: (Shake heads)
attributes.name: Bolívarian Child & Panicking Child

attributes.content: Nueda gathers the children to her side as best as she can. She takes note of the fear twisting the faces of the Sankta children, their halos flickering like mad.
(Is it empathy? That monster's empathy, the procession's empathy, an entire city's worth of empathy...)
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: (We're so far away, and yet...)
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: All Nueda can do is stay silent.
She is no Sankta. What she is dealing with is not a gang of Singas mercenaries. The complex and mysterious knowledge floating around in her mind is of no use.
She cannot even say how she got to this point.

attributes.text: What can you do to calm the children who followed you all the way from Bolívar, to console the children who had just been plucked from a terrifying dream—
At the very least, allow them to feel a modicum of tranquility.

attributes.content: East of the east of La Unidad♪
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Laterano, holy city of white♪
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Romya, i-it's a hymn...
attributes.name: Panicking Child

attributes.content: Senior Nurturer taught it to us...
attributes.name: Fearful Child

attributes.content: Sister Nueda?
attributes.name: Bolívarian Child

attributes.content: You all know the words, right?
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: There, the earth hides no bombs♪
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: There, the fields share wheat most bright♪
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: Abode of our Lord, font of parental love♪
He hears our prayers, He grants our wishes♪
All shall bask in His love♪
The K'uk'ulkan thinks back to the past. The gravely wounded nun closed herself off from the world as she sang, until pain and night melted away into her song.
The K'uk'ulkan sings once more this song she has sung a hundred thousand times before. It no longer matters who wrote it, or if the Laterano within it will answer.

She does all she can to calm her nerves so that she can sing in tune. Slowly, the voices of the children join the chorus, echoing out from the room, blending with the distant peals to form a radiant glow.
All shall bask in His love♪
attributes.name: Nueda

attributes.content: At the very least, they still have this song.
It might be of no use, but at least...
Nueda reaches under the hem of her habit, holding her axe tight.
R-Reverend?
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: I can ask our blessed companions to sniff out her position.
attributes.name: Velliv

attributes.content: There was a time when, with her gun-knight armor and custom rifle, she would break the guardian gun kill record over and over. Finding her will take time.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: The procession can't wait, Velliv. Focus on your work. I'll handle this myself.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: It's been ten years. I'm surprised this private frequency still works.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: I wanted to ask the folks at the Notarial Hall to delete it a long time ago, but I keep forgetting. Guess I've gotten old, haha.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: The real surprise is you, Aurela. Why didn't you take off your armor when you left Laterano?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Without it, how am I supposed to settle things with you... Magister?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: *sigh* You really hate me, don't you?
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: It seems the saint was right. The best motivators for the errari to return to the holy city are hatred and loathing.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Heh.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: So you're saying this mysterious 'Fall' that affected all of Terra brought out their bad side?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: That might be so for others, but for me... You know better than anyone else.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Naturally.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: I will never forget what you did to me.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: In that nomadic monastery, you wounded me yourself, read the Curia's banishment order to me yourself... You took everything away from me, yourself.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: You committed mortal sins. Your punishment was pretty light, given the circumstances.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: *sigh* I am responsible for your situation.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Aurela, your achievements earned you a commendation from the Pope himself. You were such a spirited young thing. I was convinced you would become the greatest gun-knight in history.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: But all I taught you was how to control that cumbersome armor and master your complicated gun. I never helped you with your temper, so you could truly live the Lateran life.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: And in the end, you took that final step... just as I had predicted.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Hmph. Am I supposed to thank you for worrying about my character flaws?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Just because of it, you never approved of me and Amos. You even refused to come to our wedding, even though I had hoped to get your blessing.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Maybe we should have a proper talk about all this.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: One way or another, you have returned. Will you come to my side, child? My people will not refuse you, if you join the procession.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: What, want to give a sinner like me another chance in the name of Laterano?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: No, nothing so lofty.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: The errari are still of Laterano. That is all.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: In a better Laterano, everyone will find their place and play their part. There will be more foundational, more profound connections between us all.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: No matter who you are, no matter what you have done, the Holy City will mend your halo and fix the flaws you were born with.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: When that time comes, all our pain and regrets will be healed in turn.
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: No thanks.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Aurela...
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Listen, old man—
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: I hate how self-righteous you are. I hate how weak Amos was. I hate how inflexible the Curia is. I hate Laterano's stupid garbage about harmony! I hate how cold this Paradise is!
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: I never forgot this hate, even over ten years in Bolívar!
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Even though my halo shattered, even though I was trapped in the dirt, I never once doubted that I would return!
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Even when I was enthusiastic and wet-behind-the-ears, I never felt as sure of myself as I do now!
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: This is my connection with Laterano! This is my faith!
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Your student turned out to be a cruel, vicious, selfish soul. Even if she hadn't fallen, she was still no angel!
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Tell me, old man, this 'better Laterano' of yours, if it will let in someone who was born evil, does it deserve to be called Paradise?!
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Or are you unsure about that too?!
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: Question time's over.
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: You've been trying to get a bead on me all this time... Failed?
attributes.name: Aurela

attributes.content: You've actually gotten better since you left, Aurela—
attributes.name: Patrizion

attributes.content: Grkh! *cough* *cough*—Flagritriba!
attributes.name: Paganini

attributes.content: These new glasses Vani got me... turned out really clear...
attributes.name: Paganini
